name: LOOP_IF
description: This is a process control command, i.e., it will control whether to loop back to the beginning in a WHILE/ENDW loop. This is one part of a complete command structure.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: If the expression resolves to .T. then the program will transfer control to the appropriate WHILE line. This would be the equivalent of executing the ENDW command.

comments: For more information on the different structured programming commands, and the LOOP_IF command in particular, please see Chapter 7, Structured Programming Commands.
